summary.text: This release brings Grove's powerful blog engine to life with major new features like Stripe payments and an enhanced CDN uploader with AI analysis. We've made significant improvements to the admin panel and landing page, fixed key navigation and deployment issues, and laid the groundwork for easy publishing. Overall, this update solidifies Grove as a friendly, multi-tenant platform ready to help creators build and grow their own beautiful spaces.

features: Set up GitHub Packages publishing for @autumnsgrove/groveengine
Add CDN admin upload system with R2 storage
Add Stripe payments system with provider abstraction
Add example site link to landing page and prepare workspace
Add example site showcasing all GroveEngine features
Add enhanced CDN Uploader with AI analysis to admin panel
Configure npm publishing for @groveengine packages
Complete blog engine migration from AutumnsGrove to packages/engine
Add temporary Stripe branding assets (icon + logo)
Add Grove Design System UI component library
fixes: Update engine component imports to use main export for Rollup resolution
Add smooth scroll and URL hash update to TOC navigation
Sync package-lock.json with package.json for CI
Deploy example site and update dependencies
Use hardcoded font stacks to avoid theme() lookup issues
Update success message to mention confirmation email
Enable autofill and text expansion on email input

summary.text: This release focuses on making Grove more accessible and reliable for everyone. We've resolved some technical hurdles to ensure smoother installations directly from GitHub, and we've updated our documentation to reflect the exciting split of our UI components into their own dedicated project. Think of this as a solid foundation update that paves the way for cleaner development and easier setup for our growing community.

fixes: Remove import.meta.glob from library code to fix runtime errors
Add exports to root package.json for GitHub direct installs

summary.text: This release marks a major step forward in Grove's architecture by separating our core UI into its own dedicated package. This foundational change paves the way for a more robust and customizable platform, making it easier for us to deliver exciting new features and improvements in the future. We've also updated our internal documentation to ensure a smooth transition for our development team.

features: Migrate generic UI to @groveengine/ui package

summary.text: This release brings Grove's components fully into the Svelte ecosystem, replacing React-based elements to deliver a smoother, more cohesive experience. We've enhanced markdown security and resolved key compatibility issues with Cloudflare Workers, making the platform more stable and reliable. Overall, v0.3.3 focuses on polishing the foundation for a faster and more robust blogging platform.

fixes: Bump engine to 0.3.3, use npm version for @groveengine/ui
Build UI package before example-site in CI workflow
Use workspace:* for @groveengine/ui in all packages
Use workspace reference for @groveengine/ui to avoid stale npm version
Replace React sonner with svelte-sonner to fix hydration errors
Expand DOMPurify allowed tags and attributes for markdown content
Remove unsupported --compatibility-flags from wrangler pages deploy
Remove mermaid dependency to resolve Cloudflare Workers crypto issue
Add --compatibility-flags=nodejs_compat to deploy command
Enable nodejs_compat for Cloudflare Workers

summary.text: This release brings the GroveUI components directly into the engine, making the platform more unified and easier to use. We've introduced a much-improved editor with a new MarkdownEditor and added a New Post page to the example site, while also fixing several bugs to ensure a smoother experience. Overall, this update focuses on enhancing the core authoring tools and improving stability for everyone.

features: merge GroveUI into engine
Add New Post page and update blog admin UI
Add working MarkdownEditor test page
fixes: SSR compatibility and missing exports
Resolve MarkdownEditor toolbar freeze bug

summary.text: This release brings important improvements to Grove's stability and developer experience, especially for deployments on Cloudflare. We've resolved several deployment and compatibility issues, enhanced our documentation to help you get started faster, and polished the admin panel for a smoother experience on mobile devices. It's all about making Grove more reliable and easier to work with, wherever you choose to run it.

fixes: replace sonner with svelte-sonner for Cloudflare compatibility
pass D1 binding explicitly in wrangler pages deploy
add email_signups table migration for automatic deployment
add missing email_signups table migration
resolve TypeScript errors breaking landing page build
remove non-existent packages/ui step from deploy workflow
add cache-dependency-path to pnpm workflow caching
correct gutter item positioning to align with content anchors
prevent mobile zoom issues in admin panel

summary.text: This release brings a handy live timer and loading spinners to the searcher, making your search experience feel more responsive. We've also launched a new domain finder dashboard to simplify managing your blog's address. Behind the scenes, we've conducted a thorough security audit and made important fixes to keep your data safe, all while smoothing out the development process across our tools.

features: add live elapsed timer and loading spinners to searcher
add domain finder dashboard for domains.grove.place
fixes: comprehensive security audit fixes
address additional security concerns
address security and robustness issues in domain finder
improve pnpm compatibility across monorepo

summary.text: This release brings a smarter and more polished domain search experience, now with AI provider selection, live streaming results, and enhanced mobile-friendly displays. We've also strengthened security with critical patches and improved font consistency across the platform. It’s all about making Grove’s domain tools more powerful, reliable, and delightful to use.

add AI provider selection to search UI
add SSE streaming + enhanced evaluation display
integrate enhanced domain tool with Durable Objects + live pricing
add cancel search button and endpoint
centralize config, update models to 4.5, wire up worker
add Quicksand font and update TODOS with worker status
add auto-deploy workflow for domains.grove.place

remove invalid wrangler pages deploy flags

summary.text: This release adds exciting new domain discovery features including live updates on domain availability and TLD diversity preferences, making it easier to find your perfect blog name. We've also enhanced the quiz experience with follow-up questions and improved reliability across the platform. Plus, we've fixed several bugs to ensure everything runs smoothly for your blogging journey.

features: add token tracking to domain search jobs
Add follow-up quiz to history detail page
add TLD diversity UI and live history updates
sync tokens, duration, results from worker
add auto-tag workflow on version bump

prevent negative elapsed times

summary.text: This maintenance release focuses on streamlining Grove's dependencies for better security and performance. We've updated our content filtering to use a more efficient client-side library and optimized the build process to keep production bundles lean. These improvements help ensure your blog remains fast, secure, and reliable for all your readers.

fixes: replace isomorphic-dompurify with client-only DOMPurify
add jsdom to adapter-cloudflare external config
mark jsdom as external in wrangler config
use npm for wrangler install in monorepo
exclude jsdom from production bundle

summary.text: This release focuses on polishing Grove's core writing experience, with particular attention to improving the Markdown editor for a smoother and more reliable drafting process. We've also made important security enhancements under the hood to keep your content safe. While it's primarily a maintenance update, these fixes pave the way for some exciting new features we're building for you next.

fixes: resolve UI bugs in MarkdownEditor and CSRF token flow
update ContentWithGutter to use dompurify instead of isomorphic-dompurify

summary.text: This release strengthens Grove's security and performance to better protect your content and community. We've added an extra layer of security to keep your data safe and streamlined a key process to help your blogs run even faster. It's all about making your platform more reliable and robust behind the scenes.

fixes: CSRF token header fallback and DOMPurify externalization

summary.text: This release focuses on polishing Grove's stability and security behind the scenes. We've tackled a pesky toolbar freeze and bolstered the security of your data with enhanced protections for form submissions. It's all about making your blogging experience even more reliable and secure.

fixes: resolve toolbar freeze with isProgrammaticUpdate flag
Add CSRF token to state-changing requests in api utility

summary.text: This release brings GroveAuth to life, letting you sign in seamlessly and manage your blog with confidence. We've added posting limits and made the authentication experience more reliable across the platform. Overall, this update focuses on building a secure, stable foundation for your growing community.

Add sign-in functionality to landing page

add Quicksand font to landing site

Use auth-api.grove.place for all API calls
Use auth-api.grove.place for token exchange

summary.text: Grove v0.6.0 brings a beautifully refreshed identity with our rebrand to Lattice, making the platform feel more connected and organic. We’ve rolled out a smooth new tenant onboarding flow and enhanced our multi-tenant routing so every blog feels right at home. You’ll also find a richer visual experience with a new vine-inspired landing page, more fonts, and a handy dark mode toggle—all part of our ongoing commitment to a caring, vibrant community.

update footer branding to Lattice

summary.text: This release brings a refreshed look and smarter tools to Grove. We've evolved our branding with a new, simpler leaf icon and introduced Vibe Mode, a natural language search to help you find the perfect custom domain. Under the hood, we've made important upgrades for better stability and compatibility, ensuring your blog platform runs smoothly as it grows.

summary.text: This release brings a fresh polish to Grove with a rebrand of our storage service to Amber, making it easier to recognize and use. We've also enhanced our platform plans with clearer tiers and expanded features, giving you more flexibility to grow your blog. Behind the scenes, we've added thorough testing to ensure everything runs smoothly, keeping your publishing experience reliable and enjoyable.

features: bump engine version to 0.6.2 and publish to npm
rename Cellar to Amber across documentation
rename plan tiers and expand platform plan features

summary.text: This release brings Grove's forest to life with a beautiful, interactive visualization on the new /forest page, complete with seasonally reactive trees and falling leaves. We've polished our animated logo and made several under-the-hood improvements, including converting core utilities to TypeScript for better reliability. Overall, it's a release focused on enriching the visual identity and strengthening the platform's foundation.

summary.text: This release makes it easier than ever to get started with your own blog by adding a helpful setup page for new tenants. We've also enhanced our public journey page with more historical milestones and visual timelines, giving you a clearer view of Grove's growth. Under the hood, we've cleaned up some data tracking and deployment processes to keep everything running smoothly.

summary.text: Grove's spring release brings the forest to life with dancing cherry blossoms and seasonal charm. We've strengthened our AI sanctuary by adding human verification and expanding crawler protections, while laying new groundwork with Stripe integration and backend improvements. This update polishes animations, fixes authentication flows, and deepens our commitment to a serene, creator-focused platform.

summary.text: This release brings Grove to life with smart, AI-generated release summaries that automatically populate your timeline, making it easier to track progress. We've polished the workshop with new floating icons and improved navigation, while also enhancing dark mode and accessibility across the platform. Under the hood, we've solidified our foundations with renames and fixes, setting the stage for a more intuitive and powerful experience.

summary.text: This release brings a fresh, glass-inspired aesthetic to Grove's interface with new components and seasonal touches. We've polished navigation and icons across the platform for a more consistent and delightful experience, while also adding subtle interactions and accessibility improvements. It's all about making Grove feel more vibrant and intuitive as you cultivate your blog.

summary.text: Major expansion of the workshop showcase with detailed feature pages for Bloom, Mycelium, Vista, and other tools. This release deepened Grove's documentation and added comprehensive technical specifications for internal tooling. The knowledge base grew significantly with new articles covering Grove's development philosophy and infrastructure.

summary.text: A focused release improving documentation quality and expanding the help center. The workshop page saw visual refinements with icon improvements and better mobile responsiveness.

summary.text: This release introduces Loam, Grove's new name protection system that helps keep the community safe from offensive usernames. The workshop page received major enhancements with floating icon navigation and expanded sub-icons across multiple features. Testing coverage improved with comprehensive unit tests for pricing utilities, and several accessibility fixes ensure Grove remains welcoming for all users.

You'll find a redesigned header, smarter workshop navigation, and important fixes for a smoother experience. summary.text: This release brings powerful new authentication options to Grove, including passkey, 2FA, and Discord OAuth for a more secure and flexible login experience. We've also enhanced blog reading with Safari Reader support and improved the editor's usability, all while strengthening our security posture and resolving key deployment issues. It's a significant step toward a more robust and user-friendly platform for everyone.

We've centralized tier configuration for clearer plans, added a dynamic navigation toggle for pages, and strengthened security across the platform. summary.text: This release brings exciting new ways to explore and connect within Grove, introducing the immersive Wander discovery mode and Forests for community gathering. We've strengthened our foundations by migrating to a new payment system and implementing powerful real-time features with Durable Objects. It's all about creating richer, more reliable experiences as we continue to grow the platform together.

summary.text: This release brings Grove's legal docs into the knowledge base with a handy table of contents and introduces a fun new ASCII art library for creative visuals. We've streamlined the admin experience with a refined sidebar, simplified Google-only sign-in, and completed our payment provider migration to Lemon Squeezy. Overall, it's a polish-focused update that makes the platform more cohesive and enjoyable to use, while laying important groundwork with extensive documentation and spec standardization.

While there aren't major new features this time, these refinements help ensure a smooth, reliable experience as we continue building a robust foundation for your blogs.
